com.dukes.lang.parser

Class AbstractRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dukes.lang.parser.AbstractRule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    KleinRule

    public abstract class AbstractRule
extends Object
    Describes a rule that would be found within a parse table. The rule is represented as a List, as this would allow an implementation to supply the type of the rule that would fit the implementation the best.
    Since:
    0.2.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<Enum> rule
      The rule represented as a list.

    • Field Detail

      • rule

        protected List<Enum> rule
        The rule represented as a list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractRule

        protected AbstractRule(List<Enum> rule)
        Creates a rule. This also determines whether a rule "exists". This is done by saying that a rule that has a null value does not exist, while any other value does.
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule, represented as a list.

      • AbstractRule

        protected AbstractRule()
        Constructs a non-existing rule.
        See Also:
        AbstractRule(List)

    • Method Detail

      • getRule

        public List<Enum> getRule()
        Gets the rule, represented as a list.
        Returns:
        The list representation of this rule.

      • pushRule

        public void pushRule(Stack<Enum> stack)
        Pushes a rule to the given stack. This is done in reverse order, so the first value of the list is pushed last. This is expected, as the last part of a rule should be seen last in the stack.
        Parameters:
        stack - The stack to push the rule to.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Determines whether the rule exists or not. This is represented as a null list.
        Returns:
        true if the rule exists, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Gives a string representation of the rule. If the rule exists, it is simply space seperated values of the rule, if it does not exist, this is the string "Doesn't Exist!".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the rule.
